overview:
Born an entrepreneur, Jason Carvalho has been involved in many projects throughout his career that brought him to where he is today. Most were self-created, spawn from a strong entrepreneurial drive and others were born from opportunities met along the way.

Prior to angel-backed MarilynJean, Jason was the first employee of the North American office for Indochino Apparel Inc, responsible for all online marketing and PR verticals for the venture capital backed company.

Jason was also the former co-founder and Vice President of online lending company, Fortuno Lending Lt. which was later acquired by a privately-held lending firm out of Australia in early 2009.

A first generation Canadian, Jason has felt privileged being born in the Great White North and has been dedicated to giving back to his local/provincial and federal governments.

He was recently nominated for Business in Vancouver’s 40 under 40.Jason is currently the Chief Executive Officer/co-founder of MarilynJean and can be found on Twitter @jcarvy.

Complete Biography:

Currently, Jason is Chief Executive Officer of angel backed MarilynJean.com. Based out of Vancouver BC, created by online marketing & retail veterans, MarilynJean is a referral based, private sale, online store that offers moms with exclusive deals and preferred pricing on hand-selected pregnancy, baby, kids up and family related items and services. Members, (who join for FREE), are alerted to private sale events of individual designers / boutique brands 48 to 72 hours in advance and each brand exclusive sale lasts for a total of 72 hours.

Previously he was the 1st Employee of the North American office (Vancouver, B.C) for the 1st (only) online Men’s Apparel Brand: Indochino Apparel Inc (“Indochino”). He currently held the title of “Chief Tactician”, and is currently the driver for all online marketing & pr verticals, for the 3 year old, Venture Capital backed Indochino Apparel Inc. In March 2010, Indochino was listed as one of “America’s Most Promising Startups” by Bloomberg’s Businessweek.com. INDOCHINO ABOUT US VIDEO: http://www.indochino.com/films

During 2009, Jason was an Advertising Business Development Manager with the multi-award-winning Neverblue (“Neverblue”), a global Performance Based (CPA) Network, and a wholly-owned Canadian subsidiary company of Vertrue Inc. Here his responsibilities were focused on acquiring new Advertisers in the Downloads, Online Gaming, Ecommerce and Mobile space. While at Neverblue he successfully negotiated deals with brands such as ASK.com/NASCAR, FLYCELL, REAL GAMES / Network, Zynga, WorldWinner, ONnet & more.

In the past (2005-2008), Jason worked with a Victoria based, multi-award-winning software security and online marketing company Paretologic, Inc (â€œParetologicâ€). As Paretologicâ€™s first non family employee, he held a number of titles with the company such as Corporate / Business Development Manager, Manager of Research and Development and Vice President of Business Development & Public Relations.

At Paretologic, Jasonâ€™s major responsibilities included day-to-day operations of the companyâ€™s business development and (online/offline) sales channels. Jason traveled extensively around the globe building up the traditional sales (OEM) channels for Paretologic. In addition, Jason was responsible for development, implementation, and execution of online marketing, affiliate marketing, & PPC sales strategies, including designing, and having developed web applications and web portals to increase sales. Jason is also well-versed in the development of user conversion, acquisition, and retention strategies. By 2008, Paretologic was 110 employees strong with revenues over the 30 Million mark.

Prior to joining Paretologic, Jason was the Director of Business Development & Emerging Technologies (2003-2005) for an international software solutions provider, Mercurial Communications, Inc (â€œMercurialâ€). As part of Management and Business Development at Mercurial, his efforts grew Mercurial’s employee base from 15 to 100 in 12 months. Within 10 months Jason had secured nearly 3 million CAD in contract work. During his time at Mercurial, the company was consistently listed in the Profit 100 (Canada’s fastest growing companies) list published by Canadian Business annually.

Entrepreneurship /Social Enterprise Ventures/Politics

Jason is the former co-founder and Vice President of an online lending company, Fortuno Lending Ltd (2007-2009). Fortuno was Canada’s premier online person-to-person (P2P) lending marketplace where people came together to lend and borrow money directly with one another in a safe, secure and mutually beneficial way. $75k+ in private investment was raised to launch Fortuno. Fortuno Lending Ltd.’s proprietary technology was acquired by a privately-held lending firm out of Australia in early 2009.

After attending the 1st Skoll World Forum on Social Entrepreneurship in 2003-2004 at Oxford University, Oxford, UK, he flew back and founded the Canadian Social Entrepreneurship Foundation (â€œCSEF.caâ€) six years ago, and currently sits on the Board of Directors. CSEF.ca strives to educate, innovate and celebrate Social Entrepreneurs in Canada by providing educational and funding tools to the developing social economy of Canada.

During 2010-2011 CSEF.ca will be funding “Project Give” launching @ Simon Fraser University, B.C, Canada by the Young Women In Business Society. It is a 6 month program that requires teams to pursue ideas of social change. Guided by mentors, and educated through seminars, each team will create their own unique social entrepreneurship project.

In 2004, at the 1st Skoll World Forum on Social Entrepreneurship at Oxford University, Jason was introduced to the founders of the award-winning PBS series Globaltribe. Shortly after this, the USA based non-profit organization, OneGlobaltribe (Globaltribenet.org), was founded. Jason developed and helped execute the business plan, sponsorship and marketing strategies for OneGlobaltribe.

During 2010-2011 Jason will be a Business/Entrepreneur Mentor for The Forum for Women Entrepreneur’s (“www.fwe.ca”) HSBC Mentor Program in Vancouver, BC, Canada.

FWE’s HSBC Mentor Program facilitates the mentoring between active women entrepreneurs of established businesses who are seeking improvement and growth for their companies and women/men business leaders from a variety of backgrounds.

Despite being involved in so many different projects, since 2005, Jason has been an adviser and consultant for the Silicon Valley social enterprise start-up Villagethegame.com. He wrote the social ventures first business plan which was submitted to Standford’s Social Enterprise Business Plan Competition.

Jason has been a business plan judge for the World Bank’s Development Market Place, Stanford University Business Plan Competitions and the University of Victoria’s Social Enterprise Business Plan Competition. He has fundraised for BC Cancer Foundation (Project: Journey Of Hope), YMCA Victoria BC and United Way of Victoria, BC, Canada.

As a first generation Canadian, Jason has felt very privileged being born in the Great White North and has been dedicated to giving back to his local / provincial and federal governments. He has been a volunteer for Former Mayor of Victoria, B.C, Alan Lowe (1999 & 2002 local elections), current B.C Liberal Minister Ida Chong (2000,2007 provincial elections), Liberal Member of Parliament, Keith Martin (2004,2006 federal elections). During the 2009 British Columbia Provincial Election he was the Financial Agent for the BC Liberal Candidate seeking election in the Victoria/Swan Lake Riding.

Jason has also been quoted for his various work in the Wall Street Journal, Globe and Mail, National Post, Financial Times, San Francisco Chronicle, Charity Village and WorldChanging.com
